title: Environmental Engineer
description:
51,000 people. 49 countries. Over 120 office locations.

We’re not just engineers. We’re a global team of data scientists, consultants, construction workers and innovators all working to create a better tomorrow. Every day, we help customers in energy, chemicals and resources get one step closer to solving our planet’s toughest issues. Climate change. The energy transition. Digital transformation. And how we can deliver a more sustainable world.?

Whatever your ambition, there’s a path for you here. And there’s no barrier to your potential career success. For more information, visit Worley.com

Primary Objective

  • Coordination of specified tasks within the environmental engineering discipline.
  • Responsible for the progress and quality of assigned tasks within the environment area, including the supervision of engineers and graduates.
  • To ensure all work carried out conforms with agreed codes and practices, meets all requirements of the contract’s specification, and ensures all work is carried out within agreed schedules, budgets, and procedures.
  • To provide innovative and cost-effective solutions to clients for operating problems and capacity constraints in their existing oil and gas and petrochemical operations.
  • Management, technical execution, and completion of engineering assigned tasks in a specific Environment discipline area.
  • Assisting the project engineers in the coordination and preparation of input into the contract documents for each discipline area, including design criteria, the scope of work, procedures, and design approach
  • Liaison and coordination with other engineers and discipline groups on the contract to effect timely production of deliverables.
  • Manage studies and Environment-orientated projects as assigned.
  • Development and improvement of company standards and Environment design methods.
  • Technical writing activities, in particular, the production of technical reports and operating manuals.
  • Training and mentoring of new Environment engineering graduates to enable them to achieve professional membership.
  • Quality Assurance – Responsible for working within the provisions and guidelines of the Quality Assurance system relevant to the Oil and Gas Business Unit.
  • Safety – Responsible for personal safety safe working practices for the Oil and Gas Business Unit. Understand and follow OH&S procedures.

Who You Are

  • You are an individual who is self-motivated, proactive, and works well with a team.
  • You will be seen as the Subject matter specialist for the resolution of issues arising across all areas of the job and be able to clearly explain complex processes that surround the role.
  • We expect you to ensure the integrity of the work scope and that all work is carried-out in accordance with applicable codes and standards.
  • We expect you to mentor of less experienced members of staff including ‘hands on’ approach to the formulation and delivery of training programs for local Kuwaiti personnel.

Preferred Qualification(s) And/or Experience

  • You will possess either an engineering degree in Environment or Chemical and/or an equivalent diploma from an accredited college or university. This is an essential contractual requirement.
  • You will have a minimum of Eight (8) years of total minimum work experience post qualification within the Oil & Gas or petrochemical industry, with exposure to heavy oil projects. Upstream onshore experience is preferred.
  • You will have a minimum of Five (5) years of work experience in a related designation / specialty within a GCC country. The GCC countries referred to here are: The State of Kuwait, The Kingdom of Bahrain, The Kingdom of Saudi Arabia, The Sultanate of Oman, The State of Qatar, and United Arab Emirates.
  • You must have work experience working within PMC projects in the above-mentioned industries.
  • You will have experience working with advanced engineering tools, data systems & other general office / engineering software will be given first preference.
  • You will have the ability to interact effectively with people of all nationalities & cultures while using clear, fluent, and expressive verbal and written language to convey information and ideas. An individual with excellent communication and people skills, a consummate developer of relationship(s) on a sustainable and long-term basis.
  • You will have broad based knowledge of the requirements for process engineering through all phases of project life cycle, from FEED through to Commissioning, within Oil & Gas or related industries.
  • You will demonstrate an ability to lead/coach/mentor colleagues and/or staff.
  • You will have the ability to work under tight time constraints with excellent time management and planning skills as well as manage multiple priorities.
  • You will be willing to engage and manage clients as required by the needs of the business and if deemed necessary by the Worley management.

What We Offer You

Providing an agile culture and challenging work opportunities results in a positive work environment. Our people enjoy competitive compensation packages and a fun, personal, collaborative and safe working environment. We value equal employment opportunity and are committed to promoting fairness, equality and diversity.

Our policy is to conduct background checks for all candidates who accept an offer of employment with us.

If you have the passion and talent to keep up, it's time to test the limits of what you can become. Find your future with Worley.

Worley

KWT-AMD-Ahmadi

Job

Schedule

Employee

title: SR. IT ENGINEER (ENTERPRISE ARCHITECURE) by Qatar Energy
company: Oil and Gas Job Search Ltd
description:
Job Title : SR. IT ENGINEER (ENTERPRISE ARCHITECURE)

Reference Code : OG-7004249

Company

QatarEnergy

Department

INFORMATION & COMMUNICATION TECHNOLOGY Information Technology Strategy & Enterprise Architecture

Primary Purpose Of Job

Responsible for leading and driving QatarEnergy’s ICT strategy vision, mission and strategic objectives in alignment with Enterprise Architecture Domains and Principles throughout QatarEnergy’s ICT department. And nice to have architecture design experience in Microsoft Azure and Google Cloud Platform.

Experience & Skills

A minimum of ten (10) years of progressive experience in IT Enterprise Architecture and Strategy, with at least five (5) years of demonstrated enterprise architecture qualification and discipline – TOGAF / Zachman and architecture modelling using EA tools such as ArchiMate / Alfabet / BiZZdesign, etc. is mandatory.

  • Should have experience in developing, coordinating, and executing Information Technology (IT) strategic roadmap based on corporate objectives and strategies.
  • Proven and hands-on experience in the implementation of Enterprise Architecture (EA) framework, capabilities and processes that ensures the strategic application of change is embedded in the management of the organization, ensuring buy-in of all stakeholders.
  • Should have hands-on experience in developing policies and procedures around Enterprise Architecture and understand the current EA to consider it when procuring new solutions and to determine any potential architectural gaps. Involve stakeholders and seek alignment on the proposed enterprise architecture changes.
  • Good experience and exposure in providing technology guidance to ICT strategic initiatives in alignment with QatarEnergy’s EA framework and guidelines.
  • Contribute and participate in developing solution architectures for the specific business, infrastructure, or functional areas, using appropriate tools and methods.
  • Identifies and evaluates alternative architectures, trade-offs in cost, performance, and scalability.
  • Supports strategic transformation program or strategic projects by providing consulting services on technical plans and applying design principles that comply with QatarEnergy Enterprise Architecture Standards and Principles.
  • Ability to facilitate brainstorming sessions to derive strategic/tactical architectural outcomes.
  • Maintains an awareness of current and emerging information and communications technologies and identifies possible opportunities for the business to be positively impacted by adopting such.
  • Proactively advises those engaged in activities where the technical expertise is applicable to ICT staff and related areas such as budgetary and financial planning, litigation, legislation, and health and safety.
  • Nice to have the solution architecture and design related professional certifications i.e., Microsoft Azure, Google Professional Cloud Architect, AWS Solution Architect & Information Systems Security Architecture etc.
  • Strong conceptual understanding of IT landscape (infrastructure, application & security) in providing the expertise and experience to make key technical and governance recommendations on systems and technologies considering the current infrastructure and existing/emerging technologies.
  • Good analytical and problem-solving skills with timely decision-making capabilities and highly motivated and self-directed with the ability to see the long-term vision.
  • Excellent written and verbal communication skills with the ability to work and communicate concepts as appropriate with QatarEnergy ICT and Business stakeholders, contractors etc.
  • Demonstrated experience in strategic planning and architecture.
  • Excellent people management, negotiation, and persuasion skills.
  • Demonstrated ability to manage and communicate with a multi-cultural and multi-national workforce effectively.
  • Good to have knowledge of data management strategy, data architecture and design principles.
  • Good experience and exposure of designing business processing model and notation tools.


Education

Bachelor’s degree (required) and Master’s degree (preferable) in Computer Science, Computer Engineering, or an appropriate Engineering/Business field.

title: Oracle Analytics and Oracle Data Integrator - Egypt
description:
Are you passionate about problem solving? If you are enthusiastic to learn cutting edge technologies, you have interest in innovation and you are customer-centric- we want you with us! Customer Success Services (CSS) is an organization providing tailored mission critical support services for the full Oracle Product Stack. Customer Success Services understands the customer's needs and helps them to increase availability, improve performance, mitigate risk and save cost.

CSS is looking for Engineers skilled and with real experience on Middleware technologies mainly on Oracle Analytics and Oracle Data Integrator and having knowledge on additional Middleware areas would be considered a plus.


These engineers will join the CSS Global SaaS & Apps Delivery, a team which centrally delivers proactive and reactive services for any country across the globe.

What you will do


CSS Engineers have the mission

1. To develop and manage the technical relationship with a designated account(s) in order to maximize the value of CSS to the customer,

2. To develop and maintain trusted relationships with the other Oracle contacts within designated account(s) and relevant third parties,

3. To act as the technical primary point of contact for Oracle Support and

4. To safeguard customer satisfaction, and renewal, through quality delivery and added value.


RESPONSIBILITIES:

· Delivering high quality technical results to CSS Customers.

· Ensuring adherence to internal methodology, tools and quality standards.

· Identifying required/recommended actions on Customer systems as main output of service

delivery, based on own knowledge and experience.

· Understanding customer requirements and based on own skills and experience, being able to

  • design the proper architecture using the most appropriate products,
  • design a technical plan to integrate them and
  • implement the technical solution.

· Analyzing, troubleshooting and solving whenever feasible, the issues the customer may face using

Oracle products.

· Escalating at the right time customer issues to Technical Account Manager where relevant.

· Active participation on Services development.

· Active collaboration with other engineers in the team or in other teams, to share knowledge, experiences and others, which can benefit CSS Business results.


We also use…

· Deployment and configuration of OBIEE/OAS/OAC/OBIA/ODI.

· Administration and support of OBIEE/OAS/OAC/OBIA environments.

· Troubleshooting and performance tuning.

· Developing and tuning Repository layers and init blocks as well as reports and dashboards.

· Strong Knowledge with ETL and Data warehousing.

· Strong Knowledge with BI Publisher (XML Publisher).

· Strong Knowledge with ODI and integration with OBIEE.

· WebLogic Server Hands on experience on administration, deployment, troubleshooting and

performance tuning.

· Coherence 3.6/3.7 & 12c is a plus

  • Installation, configuration, & deployment of Coherence application including cache configuration
  • Knowledge with performance tuning including Network performance test.

· Identity Management suite (OID, ODS, SSO, OIM, OAM) is a plus


What we will offer you


· A competitive salary with exciting benefits

· Flexible and remote working so you can do your best work

· Learning and development opportunities to advance your career

· An Employee Assistance Program to support your mental health

· Employee resource groups that champion our diverse communities

· Core benefits such as medical, life insurance, and access to retirement planning

· An inclusive culture that celebrates what makes you unique


Candidate REQUIREMENTS:

· University Degree;

· Fluent English

· Availability to travel and work onsite at customers

· Availability to work 24x7


At Oracle, we don’t just respect differences — we celebrate them. We believe that innovation starts with inclusion, and that to create the future, we need people with a diverse set of backgrounds, perspectives, and abilities. That’s why we’re committed to creating a workplace where all kinds of people can do their best work. When everyone’s voice is heard and valued, we’re inspired to go beyond what’s been done before. https://www.oracle.com/corporate/careers/diversity-inclusion/
